Legal_Issue: Does Section 97(1)(b)(ii) of the IRPA apply to subgroups facing heightened risks in countries with generalized crime?
Application_Facts: The applicant, a Haitian businessman, claimed persecution due to perceived wealth. The Board found his risk generalized, as all Haitians face similar dangers.
Decision_Outcome: The application for judicial review was dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the IRB's denial of asylum claim
Court_Ruling: Dismissed the application but certified the legal question for broader consideration
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution based on perceived wealth in Haiti
Legal_Standard: Section 97(1)(b)(ii) requires a personalized risk not faced generally by others in the country
Assessment_Factor: Risk level in Haiti; whether the applicant faces a personalized risk distinct from the general population
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review in Federal Court analyzing IRB decision
Evidence_Used: Information about generalized violence in Haiti; applicant's profile as a businessman
Application_Basis: Asylum claim under IRPA based on fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Nature and extent of risk to the applicant versus general population in Haiti
Relief_Sought: Allowance of asylum claim and reversal of IRB decision
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate a personalized risk beyond general danger in Haiti
Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), reviewed by Federal Court
Harm_Assessment: Generalized crime and violence in Haiti affecting all citizens
Cause_Description: Applicant's asylum claim denied by IRB due to lack of personalized risk
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed whether applicantâ€™s risk was distinct from general population
Evidence_Assessment: Risk was found to be generalized, not particularized to the applicant
Decision_Rationale: The applicant did not establish a personalized risk under Section 97(1)(b)(ii); the danger he faces is shared by the general population in Haiti
Legal_Standard_Applied: Requirement of a personalized risk under Section 97(1)(b)(ii) of the IRPA
